Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts which will include the students enlisted the Program of study sequence of classes cohort progress through the program and timeline of completion.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students which will include (but not be limited to) student name student ID admission date classes credits GPA and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary of the system log.': Functional Suitability
'Clinical site information shall include (but not be limited to) the name of the site contact person and contact information.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional Suitability
'The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that’s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface': Usability
'A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.': Functional Suitability
'A clinical lab section shall include the clinical site name the class instructor day and time of the lab.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall ensure that the database’s data corresponds to the data entered by the user. Each conference room reservation in the system will contain the same information as was entered by the user.': Security
'The product shall allow the user to view previously downloaded search results CMA reports and appointments.': Reliability
'The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user’s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.': Security
'The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.': Usability
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier program of study preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.': Functional Suitability
'The verbiage used within the system shall be consistent with Standard English and the terminology of the national Nursing Community.': Usability
'The audit report shall be displayed to the user.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites which will include information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter (Clinical site general information on labs held at that location dates and times of all labs held there).'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be available 24 hours per day seven days per week.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall interface with the student master server.'

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product’s Look and Feel shall be able to incorporate aspects of the customer’s organization such as logo branding and identity'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be expected to operate for at least 5 years for each customer installation.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'PME Subsystem shall allow building product menus based on the list of products kept in the accounting system.': Functional Suitability
'Website must interface with the CyberSource API to process credit card transactions.': Compatibility
'A database management system such as Oracle DB2 MySql or HSQL will need to be integrated with the product.': Compatibility
'The product shall be available for distribution as a packaged CD.': Compatibility
'The system shall be built such that it is as secure as possible from malicious interference.': Security
'The System shall allow on demand generation of all Inventory Quantity Adjustment documents since certain point of time.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.': Functional Suitability
'The product will allow priviledged users to view meeting schedules in multiple reporting views.': Functional Suitability
'The WCS system shall have the ability to include data for regions outside the United States and be accessed by users outside of the United States if approved by CCR management.': Performance Efficiency
'New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end will be loaded into the RFS system prior to the budget start process.': Maintainability
'The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation 98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.': Usability
'All credit card information will be secured on the server and only accessible by authorized Izogn administrators. Information will be encrypted in the database.': Security
'The product shall display a map of the company building showing conference room locations.': Functional Suitability
'The leads washing functionality shall receive a period list of available reps from the enterprise system.': Functional Suitability
'The system interface will use CCR nomenclature. The system must use the same nomenclature used in the existing WCS system and reports': Usability
'The product shall be able to handle up to 1500 simultaneous users. The system shall perform with 1500 users as a time.': Performance Efficiency
'The system shall interface with CampusConnect’s central server': Compatibility
'For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process a case activity will be generated. Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product must be able to interface with various email servers. The product shall be able to send email.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Pre-paid cards shall be distributed via email or via a printed paper card.': Functional Suitability
'Website must interface with the CyberSource API to process credit card transactions.': Compatibility
'System shall allow users to update their billing and contact information via the “My Account” section of the website.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System. This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant’s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.': Compatibility
'System shall let customers register on the website as a “pay as you go” user in under 5 minutes.': Performance Efficiency
'Website shall request and authorize credit card payment before allowing a user to stream a movie.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.': Functional Suitability
'Customer shall be able to check the status of their prepaid card by entering in the PIN number in under 5 seconds.': Performance Efficiency
'System will allow customers to pay for a streaming movie with a pre-paid card.': Functional Suitability
'All credit card information will be secured on the server and only accessible by authorized Izogn administrators. Information will be encrypted in the database.': Security
'The product shall ensure that only company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs may have product access. 100% of all logons shall be by either company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs.': Security
'100% of the cardmember and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.': Usability
'The product must be able to interface with any HTML browser. The product shall transmit data between the user and the product without problems. The product shall display HTML properly in 80% of all HTML browsers tested (minimum is to test 8 browsers).': Compatibility
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Information Database. The Cardmember Information Database provides detailed information with regard to a cardmember. All cardmember detail information must be obtained from the Cardmember Information Database.': Compatibility
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.': Security
'The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.': Compatibility
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional Suitability
'Clinical site information shall include (but not be limited to) the name of the site contact person and contact information.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall ensure that the database’s data corresponds to the data entered by the user. Each conference room reservation in the system will contain the same information as was entered by the user.': Security
'The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.': Functional Suitability
'Website shall allow customers to view reviews of selected movies by other customers.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.': Reliability
'Vendor will submit a credit validation record to be applied to the enterprise billing system.': Functional Suitability
'Users shall be able to reach the ‘add’ ‘drop’ and ‘trade player’ pages with one click from the team owner’s page.': Usability
'The product shall be available for distribution via the Internet as a binary or ZIP file.': Compatibility
'The website shall make its user aware of its information practices before collection data from them via a Privacy Policy accessible on all pages of the website.': Security
'The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.': Performance Efficiency
'The product will be available for licensing as a one-server two-five servers or five-or-more servers license.': Compatibility
'The product shall make the users want to use it. 80% of the users surveyed report they are regularly using the product after the first 2 weeks post-launch.': Usability
'New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end will be loaded into the RFS system prior to the budget start process.': Maintainability
'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Website shall allow customers to purchase pre-paid cards of $5 $10 or $20 value either by credit card or mail-in payment option.'

'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product must comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities. 95% of the product look & feel will be approved by the Architecture group prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The process must fit within the processing time conditions set forth by the Auto Rep Assignment process in which a lead is assigned within 3 minutes of the total life cycle.': Performance Efficiency
On a 56k connection the system response time for all operations must be no more than 6 seconds 90% of the time.': Performance Efficiency
'The response time of general student management tasks shall take no longer than 5 seconds and the response time of schedule generation shall take no longer than 30 seconds.': Performance Efficiency
'Any interface between a user and the automated system shall have a maximum response time of 5 seconds unless noted by an exception below.': Performance Efficiency
The system shall be responsive. At the DePaul TeleServices Center when a supervisor uses the system to view a callers schedule the system response time must be no more than 2 seconds 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds the rest of the time.': Performance Efficiency
'For leads that process longer than 25 seconds the system will record the event and duration': Performance Efficiency
'The response shall be fast enough to avoid interrupting the user’s flow of thought. 90% of tasks shall complete within 5 seconds. 98% of tasks shall complete within 8 seconds.': Performance Efficiency

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'No lead evaluation will complete in a time period longer than 25 seconds for 97% of all leads processed.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'The product shall provide Error Tracking Services.The product shall help the System Administrators and DBAs to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time.': Usability
'We must be able to interface with any HTML browser.': Compatibility
'Only authorized user shall access the RFS system. ONLY users that exist in the UAS system with the RFS system assigned to their role(s) shall access the RFS system and use it.': Security
'All credit card information will be secured on the server and only accessible by authorized Izogn administrators. Information will be encrypted in the database.': Security
'100% of cardmember services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.': Usability
'The website shall make its user aware of its information practices before collection data from them via a Privacy Policy accessible on all pages of the website.': Security
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall be installed by an untrained realtor without recourse to separately-printed instructions.': Usability
'The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall remain operational as a result of the input of malicious data. The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall not crash 100% of the time that malicious data is input into the product.': Reliability
'The product shall adhere to the corporate Architecture guidelines': Compatibility
'The product shall allow a player to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: The interface shall be appealing to callers and supervisors. In the interface and usability survey 80% of beta testers must report that the interface is appealing.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The system shall link Events back to either the Sync Matrix 1.0 or the Exercise Managment Tool 1.0 applications for modifications.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall offer a display of all the Events in the exercise.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts which will include the students enlisted the Program of study sequence of classes cohort progress through the program and timeline of completion.': Functional Suitability
'2 out of 3 Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall successfully be able to use the system to manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals.': Usability
'The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that’s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface': Usability
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students which will include (but not be limited to) student name student ID admission date classes credits GPA and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.': Functional Suitability
'The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard': Usability
'The product shall be easy to use by Adjusters and Collision Estimators. 95% of Adjusters and Collision Estimators shall find the product easy to use.': Usability
'The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.': Usability
'The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. Nine out ten users shall be able to successfully complete a game with no training.': Usability
'The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation 98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.': Usability
'The system shall help the user avoid making mistakes while scheduling classes and clinicals for the nursing students.': Usability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be able to display calendar dates and times according to the user’s locale. 90% of survey respondents from each target market country will find that the date and time formatting of the product is correct.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Staff members shall be able to complete a set of tasks in a timely manner.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section for that class.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier program of study preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical site into the system.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department including the Program of study name and required classes for that Program of Study.': Functional Suitability
'A Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member shall be able to add a new nursing student to the system.': Functional Suitability
'The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.': Functional Suitability
'For each class within a sequence for a cohort Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.': Functional Suitability
'For each class within a sequence for a cohort Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.': Functional Suitability
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Nursing Student including student ID student name phone number e-mail status (full time or part time) and program of study.': Functional Suitability
'A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.': Functional Suitability
'2 out of 3 Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall successfully be able to use the system to manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals.': Usability
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students which will include (but not be limited to) student name student ID admission date classes credits GPA and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.': Functional Suitability
'A staff member shall have the ability to manage the progress of a part time student which includes modifying their sequence of classes and timeline of classes.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall be able to delete room equipment.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product will be able to delete conference rooms.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall give users feedback when necessary. 80% of the users surveyed report that the product accurately confirms their actions.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The search for recycled parts shall take no longer than 15 seconds. The search results shall be returned in under 15 seconds.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'A new user shall be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page.': Usability
'Users shall be able to reach the ‘add’ ‘drop’ and ‘trade player’ pages with one click from the team owner’s page.': Usability
'System shall allow users to update their billing and contact information via the “My Account” section of the website.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Users should only have to navigate through a maximum of 4 pages to create an account with the website.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'If projected the data must be readable. On a 10x10 projection screen 90% of viewers must be able to read Event / Activity data from a viewing distance of 30'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'All customer information will be stored on a secure database accessible only to authorized personnel.': Security

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'All credit card information will be encrypted in the database.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can enter a caller’s schedule.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered number of sections needed number of labs needed and room types needed.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'An employee will be able to successfully use the product within a few minutes. After informally navigating the product for less than 15 minutes users shall be able to successfully setup meetings and reserve conference rooms.': Usability
'The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. : 90% of new users shall be able to start the display of Events or Activities within 90 minutes of using the product.': Usability
'The product shall make the users want to use it. 80% of the users surveyed report they are regularly using the product after the first 2 weeks post-launch.': Usability
'The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.': Reliability
'The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.': Reliability

'The product will display an available status for unreserved conference rooms.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall achieve a 98% uptime. The product shall not fail more than 2% of the available online time.': Reliability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The website shall continue to operate if the payment gateway goes down.': Reliability
'The product shall adhere to the corporate online availability schedule. The application is brought down only within 98% of the scheduled outages per the availability schedule.': Reliability
'Website must be fully operational with MSN TV2.': Compatibility
': The product shall continue to operate during upgrade change or new resource addition.The product shall be able to continue to operate with no interruption in service due to new resource additions.': Maintainability

'The product shall be able to be installed in the specified environment within 1 working day.': Compatibility
'Product installations and upgrades shall be handled by the middleware technology team within established launch time frames.': Compatibility

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The website shall continue to operate if the streaming server goes down.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The recycled parts audit report shall be returned to the user within 10 seconds. The audit report shall be returned within 10 seconds.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall display the Events in a graph by time.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: The system shall be easy to use by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors must be able to accomplish any system task within 2 minutes.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'When a game is ended the product shall allow each player to identify himself or herself as an available player in the list of players.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Total lead cycle time must be completed in 5 minutes for 90% of lead volume between the business hours of 8AM CST to 8PM CST; then 3 minutes for 99% of lead volume during off business hours.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes System must provide the ability to view existing dispute cases.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.': Functional Suitability
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.': Security
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.': Security
'The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.': Usability
'The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user’s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.': Security
'The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System. This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant’s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.': Compatibility

For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application. This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.': Compatibility

'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be easy for customers with novice skills on the Internet to purchase and watch streaming movies. Customers should be able to purchase and watch a pre-determined movie in under 3 minutes.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.': Performance Efficiency
'The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.': Compatibility
'The product shall achieve a 98% uptime. The product shall not fail more than 2% of the available online time.': Reliability
'The product shall be able to send meeting notifications via different kinds of end-user specified methods.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.': Usability
'The customer shall be able to easily integrate new building maps with the product throughout the product’s lifecycle. Integration of new maps with the product shall be possible with little to no support from product support staff.': Maintainability
'The product must be developed with the J2SE/J2EE programming language libraries': Compatibility
'The product shall provide GUI based Monitoring Services.System Administrators shall monitor message exchanges will predict and determine problems and will also provide internal and external support.': Usability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall provide Asynchronous Messaging.The product shall provide asynchronous messaging to enable parallel processing and reduce the overhead in communications'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Maintenance releases will be offered to customers once a year. The releases shall take no longer than 5 minutes for 80% of the customer base to install.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional Suitability
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System. This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant’s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.': Compatibility
'The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user’s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.': Security
'The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.': Compatibility

'The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application. This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.': Compatibility

'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information; the dispute case number the type of chargeback requested (pending or immediate) and the date that the merchant response is due.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The System shall generate Inventory Quantity Adjustment document automatically when daily Product Sales data is available.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player’s ships which had not been previously marked as sunk.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall respond fast to keep up-to-date data in the display.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user. The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list. For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.': Functional Suitability
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The list of dispute cases that are displayed after a search is performed must be color coded for easy identification of dispute cases based upon the dispute case status.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'The product shall store new conference rooms.': Functional Suitability
'The product shall display a map of the company building showing conference room locations.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall display conference rooms according to search parameters.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

'The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.': Usability
'The product shall retain user preferences in the event of a failure.': Reliability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'When a shot is marked as a hit the product shall simulate the sound of a shot hitting its target.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The current repair facility ratings shall be displayed to the user.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Each page shall contain a navigation menu which shows the index into which the current page is contained.': Usability
'The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard': Usability

'The customer shall be able to easily integrate new building maps with the product throughout the product’s lifecycle. Integration of new maps with the product shall be possible with little to no support from product support staff.': Maintainability
'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Each page shall contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.': Functional Suitability

'The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.': Security
'The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.': Security
'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System. This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant’s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.': Compatibility
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional Suitability
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional Suitability

'The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members’ planning purposes.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members are the only people who shall have access to clinical site details.': Security
'Only authorized users shall have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.': Security

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Only authorized users shall have access to clinical site information.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The appearance of the product shall appear professional'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Izogn Administrator must be able to update the category listings on the website within 2 minutes.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall process messages within 2 seconds.The product shall have a maximum message processing time of 2 seconds': Performance Efficiency

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The website shall protect itself from intentional abuse and notify the administrator at all occurrences.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall provide GUI based Monitoring Services.System Administrators shall monitor message exchanges will predict and determine problems and will also provide internal and external support.': Usability
'The product shall have audit capabilities.The product shall store messages for a minimum of one year for audit and transaction tracking purposes.': Security
'The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.': Usability
'The product shall provide Error Tracking Services.The product shall help the System Administrators and DBAs to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time.': Usability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall provide Portals.The product shall help System Administrators to analyze the transactions with ad-hoc reporting and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'For each shot the product shall examine the defensive grid of the defensive player to determine whether the shot was a hit or miss.': Functional Suitability
'For each shot the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the offensive grid of the offensive player.': Functional Suitability
'For each shot the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid of the defensive player.': Functional Suitability
'If the shot was marked as a hit the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.': Functional Suitability
'If the shot was marked as a miss the product shall change the status of the offensive player to defensive': Functional Suitability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'For each shot the product shall notify the players whether the shot was a hit or miss.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'The response time shall be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game. The response time shall be no more than 2 seconds for 95% of responses and no more than 4% for the remaining responses.': Performance Efficiency

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product interface should be fast. The response time of the product interface should not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time. For 10% of the time the response time should not be more than 10 seconds.not be more than 10 seconds.'

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system will display a blank set of ratings if there are not ratings yet defined.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The website should use Flash to provide animation on the home page.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be translated into foreign languages other than the target market countries’ languages in future releases. For each emerging target market it shall take no more than 5 days to configure the product for that market’s language.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional Suitability
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional Suitability

'The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.': Security

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365 with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows. Monday – Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Only authorized user shall access the RFS system. ONLY users that exist in the UAS system with the RFS system assigned to their role(s) shall access the RFS system and use it.': Security
'The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.': Security
'Only authorized users shall have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.': Security
'The product shall ensure that only company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs may have product access. 100% of all logons shall be by either company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs.': Security
'The System shall granularly control access rights to all major subsystems. It should be possible to assign access rights to all subsystems independently.': Security
'The product shall ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized users. The product will be able to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts': Security

Access to functionality within RFS system is dependent on the privileges/permission assigned to the role..'

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product is expected to integrate with multiple database management systems. The product will operate with Oracle SQL Server DB2 MySQL HSQL and MS Access.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional Suitability, Usability, Performance Efficiency, Security, Compatibility, Reliability, Maintainability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:
